bmi.title: BMI Calculator
bmi.description: Calculate your Body Mass Index (BMI) to start healthy weight management

meaning.0: BMI is an obesity index calculated from height and weight
meaning.1: Used as a reference indicator for overall health status
meaning.2: Has limitations as it doesn't reflect muscle mass, bone density, etc.
meaning.3: Observe weight changes through regular measurements

management.0: Balanced diet and regular exercise are important
management.1: Steady management is more effective than rapid weight changes
management.2: Consult with professionals considering individual differences
management.3: Stress management and adequate sleep are also necessary

1.title: Accurate Measurement
1.content: Measure in the morning on an empty stomach for the most accurate results.

2.title: Regular Check
2.content: Measure regularly 1-2 times per month to observe change trends.

3.title: Goal Setting
3.content: Set a step-by-step plan targeting a healthy BMI range.

diet.title: Balanced Diet
diet.content: Properly distribute protein, carbohydrates, and fats in your intake.

exercise.title: Regular Exercise
exercise.content: Recommended 3-5 times per week, 30+ minutes of aerobic exercise.

sleep.title: Adequate Sleep
sleep.content: 7-8 hours of quality sleep daily helps with weight management.

water.title: Sufficient Hydration
water.content: Drink 8+ glasses of water daily to boost metabolism.

riskTable.title: BMI and Health Risk

obese2.concerns: Metabolic syndrome, joint disease, sleep apnea

riskTable.note: * Individual differences may apply. Consult medical professionals for accurate diagnosis.

classification.title: BMI Classification Standards

measurement.0: Morning measurements on an empty stomach are most accurate
measurement.1: Place the tape measure lightly against the skin
measurement.3: Take multiple measurements and use the average

management.0: Balanced diet and regular exercise are fundamental
management.1: Strength training to increase muscle mass reduces body fat percentage
management.2: Aim for gradual changes rather than rapid weight loss
management.3: Adequate sleep and stress management are also important

measurementGuide.title: Accurate Circumference Measurement Methods

waistTips.3: Place lightly against skin, don't squeeze

neckTips.0: Measure at the narrowest part of the neck
neckTips.3: Don't extend or retract the neck

hipTips.0: Measure at the widest part of the hips

measurementGuide.measurementTipText: Morning measurements after using the bathroom and before eating provide the most accurate results.
